question: What does this early-year marketing data reveal about advertising spend optimization?

options.A: Early-year shows an optimal spending range around $60K that maximizes sales performance.
options.B: Marketing spend has no relationship with sales performance in early-year periods.
options.C: Higher marketing spend always leads to higher sales in early-year periods.
options.D: We need data from all seasons to determine if this pattern holds year-round.

explanation: The chart shows an inverted U-shape where sales peak at around $60K spend ($120K sales) and decline with both lower and higher spending. This suggests an optimal spending range for early-year periods. However, this cherry-picked data only shows January-May, hiding potentially different patterns in summer, fall, or winter that might show different optimal spending levels or no optimal point at all.
